title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0238

segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Katherine, and today we're bringing you another elementary-level lesson as a part of our interview series.
segments.cn: 我叫Katherine，今天我们将为您带来另一节初级课程，作为我们访谈系列的一部分。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: This is part two of the interview series, and the last part we talked about, well, a brief introduction when you arrive to a job interview.
segments.cn: 这是访谈系列的第二部分，上一部分我们谈到了您到达工作面试时的简要介绍。

segments.en: But on this occasion, we're going to talk a little bit about yourself and your life.
segments.cn: 但这次，我们将谈谈您自己和您的生活。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So this is the most personal part, I think, of an interview.
segments.cn: 所以这是面试中最个人化的部分，我认为。

segments.en: Let's take a listen to today's dialogue, and we'll be back in a moment to talk more about the things that you've heard.
segments.cn: 让我们来听听今天的对话，稍后我们会回来讨论您所听到的内容。

segments.en: Now, Ms. Childs passed on your resume to me, and I've had a chance to look it over.
segments.cn: 现在，Childs女士把您的简历转给了我，我有机会看了一下。

segments.en: I must say, I'm quite impressed.
segments.cn: 我必须说，我很印象深刻。

segments.en: Thank you very much.
segments.cn: 非常感谢。

segments.en: I've tried to keep it short and clear.
segments.cn: 我尽量保持简短明了。

segments.en: If there are any questions, please feel free to ask me.
segments.cn: 如果有任何问题，请随时问我。

segments.en: Well, yes, I do have a number of questions, but perhaps first you could give me a brief overview.
segments.cn: 嗯，是的，我确实有一些问题，但也许您可以先给我一个简要概述。

segments.en: I'd like to get a little bit of an idea of your background.
segments.cn: 我想了解一下您的背景。

segments.en: Yes, of course.
segments.cn: 是的，当然。

segments.en: Well, as you can see from the resume, I'm 27 and grew up in Brooklyn, New York, although our family moved to London when I was quite young, at around 16.
segments.cn: 如您所见，我27岁，出生在纽约布鲁克林，虽然我们的家人在我很小的时候，大约16岁时搬到了伦敦。

segments.en: Ah, I see.
segments.cn: 啊，我明白了。

segments.en: So you were actually educated in Europe.
segments.cn: 所以您实际上是在欧洲接受教育的。

segments.en: Yes, precisely.
segments.cn: 是的，确切地说。

segments.en: Although I was born in the U.S., I would definitely call London home.
segments.cn: 虽然我出生在美国，但我绝对称伦敦为家。

segments.en: But as you see, I've actually spent a lot of my life moving from country to country.
segments.cn: 但如您所见，我实际上花了很多时间在不同国家之间移动。

segments.en: My father was in the oil business before he retired, so we also spent a number of years in Saudi Arabia, too.
segments.cn: 我父亲在退休前从事石油行业，所以我们也在沙特阿拉伯待了几年。

segments.en: Very interesting.
segments.cn: 非常有趣。

segments.en: So it seems you had quite an adventurous childhood.
segments.cn: 所以看起来您有一个相当冒险的童年。

segments.en: Absolutely.
segments.cn: 绝对是。

segments.en: We were never still for too long, but now I'm really looking to settle down.
segments.cn: 我们从来没有停留太久，但现在我真的想安定下来。

segments.en: I see.
segments.cn: 我明白了。

segments.en: Okay, well, let's move on to discuss your education, shall we?
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们继续讨论您的教育，可以吗？

segments.en: Sure.
segments.cn: 当然。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So obviously this person had a very interesting life, and they use some pretty interesting words there.
segments.cn: 显然这个人过着非常有趣的生活，他们使用了一些相当有趣的词汇。

segments.en: So why don't we take a look at five key words that we have prepared for you on Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 那么我们为什么不看看我们为您准备的五个关键词呢？

segments.en: Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言要点。

segments.en: Alright, so the first word that we have is right when Mr. Parsons talked to Ms. Childs, and he said that he was very impressed with her resume.
segments.cn: 好的，第一个词是当Parsons先生与Childs女士交谈时，他说他对她的简历印象深刻。

segments.en: Alright, so someone says, I'm impressed when they think that something that you did or something about you is very interesting or good or better than most people's.
segments.cn: 好的，所以当某人说“我很印象深刻”时，他们认为您做的事情或您身上的某些东西非常有趣或好，或者比大多数人更好。

segments.en: That's right, so you're kind of amazed, you're kind of, you're like, wow, right?
segments.cn: 没错，所以您有点惊讶，您会说，哇，对吧？

segments.en: And so this is an adjective.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个形容词。

segments.en: I am impressed.
segments.cn: 我很印象深刻。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So teachers sometimes say this.
segments.cn: 所以老师有时会这样说。

segments.en: Maybe when you do really, really, really well on a test, they say, hey, Marco, I'm really impressed.
segments.cn: 也许当您在考试中表现得非常非常好时，他们会说，嘿，Marco，我真的很印象深刻。

segments.en: You got 99%.
segments.cn: 你得了99%。

segments.en: Parents say this too, friends, family.
segments.cn: 父母也会这样说，朋友，家人。

segments.en: So basically this is a way to say good job, wow.
segments.cn: 所以基本上这是说“干得好，哇”的一种方式。

segments.en: Right, and there's also a verb.
segments.cn: 对，还有一个动词。

segments.en: So this is the adjective to be impressed, and the verb form would be to impress someone.
segments.cn: 所以这是形容词“印象深刻”，而动词形式是“给某人留下印象”。

segments.en: So that's obviously if you impress your teacher by studying, your teacher will be impressed.
segments.cn: 所以显然如果您通过学习给老师留下了印象，您的老师会感到印象深刻。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And following that, Mr. Parson has some questions about Ms. Child's background.
segments.cn: 接下来，Parsons先生对Childs女士的背景有一些问题。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: He asked her for a brief overview of her background.
segments.cn: 他问她能否简要概述一下她的背景。

segments.en: So we have two interesting words there.
segments.cn: 所以我们有两个有趣的词。

segments.en: An overview.
segments.cn: 概述。

segments.en: What is an overview?
segments.cn: 概述是什么？

segments.en: An overview is like a summary.
segments.cn: 概述就像是一个总结。

segments.en: It's basically a way to ask for someone to give you a lot of information in very few words.
segments.cn: 基本上是请求某人用很少的词给您提供大量信息的一种方式。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So you don't really want too much detail.
segments.cn: 所以您并不想要太多细节。

segments.en: You don't want somebody to tell you their life in detail.
segments.cn: 您不想让某人详细告诉您他们的生活。

segments.en: You just want a brief summary.
segments.cn: 您只想要一个简要的总结。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So not, I was born on August 11th in 1979, and I was, and then I went into this, and no, this is basic, simple, you know, this is where I'm from, this is where I went to school, the end.
segments.cn: 所以不是，我在1979年8月11日出生，然后我进入这个，然后不，这基本上是简单的，您知道的，这是我来自哪里，这是我上学的地方，结束。

segments.en: And well, he wanted a brief overview of her background.
segments.cn: 而且，他想要她背景的简要概述。

segments.en: What exactly is her background?
segments.cn: 她的背景到底是什么？

segments.en: Well, think about the word back.
segments.cn: 嗯，想想“背景”这个词。

segments.en: Okay, that means behind.
segments.cn: 好吧，这意味着在后面。

segments.en: Or in this case, background is your personal history.
segments.cn: 或者在这种情况下，背景是您的个人历史。

segments.en: So you could ask someone, what's your background?
segments.cn: 所以您可以问某人，您的背景是什么？

segments.en: It means where are you from?
segments.cn: 这意味着您来自哪里？

segments.en: Or, you know, what have you been doing up to up to now in your life?
segments.cn: 或者，您知道，您到目前为止在生活中做了什么？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And precisely when he asked her about her background, now she's starting to talk about her her life that in general terms, as we said, it's an overview.
segments.cn: 而且当他问她的背景时，她开始谈论她的生活，通常来说，这是一个概述。

segments.en: So she said that she's 27, and she's from Brooklyn, etc.
segments.cn: 所以她说她27岁，来自布鲁克林，等等。

segments.en: So she starts giving very general information about herself and her life.
segments.cn: 所以她开始提供关于自己和她生活的非常一般的信息。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So when she starts to do this, Mr. Parson has more specific questions about her life because he wants to know details.
segments.cn: 所以当她开始这样做时，Parsons先生对她的生活有了更具体的问题，因为他想知道细节。

segments.en: So he asks her then where she was educated.
segments.cn: 所以他接着问她在哪里接受教育。

segments.en: So this this phrase to be educated is very important.
segments.cn: 所以“接受教育”这个短语非常重要。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So he's asking her you studied in Europe.
segments.cn: 所以他在问她，您是在欧洲学习的。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: To be educated means to have someone teach you or to go to school somewhere.
segments.cn: “接受教育”意味着有人教您或您在某个地方上学。

segments.en: So for example, I was educated in America.
segments.cn: 例如，我在美国接受教育。

segments.en: Where were you educated, Marco?
segments.cn: Marco，您在哪里接受教育？

segments.en: I was educated in Chile.
segments.cn: 我在智利接受教育。

segments.en: Wow.
segments.cn: 哇。

segments.en: So you've been educated in a number of different places, right?
segments.cn: 所以您在不同的地方接受过教育，对吗？

segments.en: At home and in a different country.
segments.cn: 在家和在其他国家。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: But you can also specify the university name, right?
segments.cn: 但您也可以指定大学的名称，对吗？

segments.en: For example, I was educated at Harvard.
segments.cn: 例如，我在哈佛大学接受教育。

segments.en: Can you say that?
segments.cn: 您可以这样说吗？

segments.en: You can.
segments.cn: 可以。

segments.en: Or I was educated at a number of different schools.
segments.cn: 或者我在许多不同的学校接受教育。

segments.en: So you can say I studied or I was educated.
segments.cn: 所以您可以说我学习过或我接受过教育。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And well, apparently she was moving around from Europe, United States.
segments.cn: 而且，显然她在欧洲和美国之间移动。

segments.en: So Mr. Parsons says, wow, it seems that you had an adventurous childhood.
segments.cn: 所以Parsons先生说，哇，看来您有一个冒险的童年。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: This is a great adjective.
segments.cn: 这是一个很好的形容词。

segments.en: Adventurous.
segments.cn: 冒险的。

segments.en: You can say a person is adventurous.
segments.cn: 你可以说一个人是冒险的。

segments.en: So Marco is very adventurous.
segments.cn: 所以马尔科非常冒险。

segments.en: He likes to jump out of airplanes.
segments.cn: 他喜欢从飞机上跳下来。

segments.en: But you can also say that an experience is adventurous, like moving around a lot as a child.
segments.cn: 但你也可以说一个经历是冒险的，比如小时候经常搬家。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So I guess adventurous can go hand in hand with exciting or very interesting, full of emotions.
segments.cn: 所以我想冒险可以和刺激或非常有趣、充满情感的东西相结合。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Adventure adventurous.
segments.cn: 冒险的冒险。

segments.en: So a person can be adventurous.
segments.cn: 所以一个人可以是冒险的。

segments.en: And we actually had a lesson about this.
segments.cn: 我们实际上有一节课是关于这个的。

segments.en: When we describe personalities, you can say someone is adventurous.
segments.cn: 当我们描述个性时，可以说某人是冒险的。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: So five keywords that we just took a look at.
segments.cn: 所以我们刚刚看过的五个关键词。

segments.en: Why don't we go back, listen to the dialogue again, and we'll be back to talk a little bit more on Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不回去，再听一遍对话，然后回来聊聊流利度提升。

segments.en: Now, Miss Child's passed on your resume to me, and I've had a chance to look it over.
segments.cn: 现在，查尔德小姐把你的简历转给了我，我有机会看了一下。

segments.en: I must say, I'm quite impressed.
segments.cn: 我必须说，我很印象深刻。

segments.en: Thank you very much.
segments.cn: 非常感谢。

segments.en: I've tried to keep it short and clear.
segments.cn: 我尽量保持简短明了。

segments.en: If there are any questions, please feel free to ask me.
segments.cn: 如果有任何问题，请随时问我。

segments.en: Well, yes, I do have a number of questions, but perhaps first you could give me a brief overview.
segments.cn: 嗯，是的，我确实有很多问题，但也许你可以先给我一个简要概述。

segments.en: I'd like to get a little bit of an idea of your background.
segments.cn: 我想了解一下你的背景。

segments.en: Yes, of course.
segments.cn: 是的，当然。

segments.en: Well, as you can see from the resume, I'm 27 and grew up in Brooklyn, New York, although our family moved to London when I was quite young, at around 16.
segments.cn: 嗯，正如你从简历中看到的，我27岁，成长于纽约布鲁克林，虽然我们的家人在我很小的时候，大约16岁时搬到了伦敦。

segments.en: Ah, I see.
segments.cn: 啊，我明白了。

segments.en: So you were actually educated in Europe.
segments.cn: 所以你实际上是在欧洲受教育的。

segments.en: Yes, precisely.
segments.cn: 是的，确切地说。

segments.en: Although I was born in the US, I would definitely call London home.
segments.cn: 虽然我出生在美国，但我绝对称伦敦为家。

segments.en: But as you see, I've actually spent a lot of my life moving from country to country.
segments.cn: 但如你所见，我实际上花了很多时间在不同国家之间移动。

segments.en: My father was in the oil business before he retired, so we also spent a number of years in Saudi Arabia, too.
segments.cn: 我父亲在退休前从事石油行业，所以我们也在沙特阿拉伯待了好几年。

segments.en: Very interesting.
segments.cn: 非常有趣。

segments.en: So it seems you had quite an adventurous childhood.
segments.cn: 所以看起来你有一个相当冒险的童年。

segments.en: Absolutely.
segments.cn: 绝对是。

segments.en: We were never still for too long.
segments.cn: 我们从来没有停留太久。

segments.en: But now I'm really looking to settle down.
segments.cn: 但现在我真的想安定下来。

segments.en: I see.
segments.cn: 我明白了。

segments.en: Okay, well, let's move on to discuss your education, shall we?
segments.cn: 好吧，我们来讨论一下你的教育情况，好吗？

segments.en: Sure.
segments.cn: 当然。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So we have four phrases for you on Fluency Builder prepared.
segments.cn: 所以我们为你准备了四个流利度提升的短语。

segments.en: And let's start on with the first one.
segments.cn: 让我们开始第一个。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 流利度提升。

segments.en: Okay, so at the very beginning, Mr. Parsons is continuing what he was saying in our first part.
segments.cn: 好的，所以在一开始，帕森斯先生继续他在第一部分中所说的内容。

segments.en: So Mr. Parsons is talking about Rebecca's resume, and he says, someone, the secretary, she passed it on to me.
segments.cn: 所以帕森斯先生在谈论丽贝卡的简历，他说，有人，秘书，她把它转给了我。

segments.en: So this verb, to pass on.
segments.cn: 所以这个动词，转交。

segments.en: This is really important.
segments.cn: 这真的很重要。

segments.en: What does this mean?
segments.cn: 这是什么意思？

segments.en: Well, the secretary, Ms. Childs, passed on Rebecca's resume.
segments.cn: 嗯，秘书查尔德小姐把丽贝卡的简历转交给了我。

segments.en: That basically means Ms. Childs received it, and she didn't keep it.
segments.cn: 这基本上意味着查尔德小姐收到了它，并且她没有保留它。

segments.en: She passed it on, or she gave it to another person, in this case, Mr. Parsons.
segments.cn: 她转交了，或者说她把它给了另一个人，在这种情况下是帕森斯先生。

segments.en: Okay, so this implies, this shows that something doesn't stay with one person, like you said, Marco, but it moves from one person to another person.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这意味着，这表明某样东西不会停留在一个人身上，就像你说的，马尔科，而是从一个人转移到另一个人。

segments.en: So for example, my mother told me to pass this message on to you.
segments.cn: 所以例如，我母亲让我把这个消息转告给你。

segments.en: The message is not for me, it's for you.
segments.cn: 这个消息不是给我的，而是给你的。

segments.en: I think also with physical traits, like maybe if your mother had green eyes, you can maybe say, my mom passed on her eye color on to me.
segments.cn: 我想在身体特征上也是如此，比如如果你母亲有绿色眼睛，你可以说，我妈妈把她的眼睛颜色传给了我。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So you got it from her.
segments.cn: 所以你是从她那里得到的。

segments.en: All right, so that's what happened with the resume.
segments.cn: 好的，所以这就是简历的情况。

segments.en: And he said, well, she passed it on, and I've had the chance to look it over.
segments.cn: 他提到，她转交了，我有机会看了一下。

segments.en: Okay, so think about this as a chunk, as a group of words that we use together to look something over.
segments.cn: 好的，所以把这个视为一个词组，我们一起使用来查看某样东西。

segments.en: We can say, hey, Marco, when you have a minute, can you look this over for me?
segments.cn: 我们可以说，嘿，马尔科，当你有空的时候，可以帮我看一下这个吗？

segments.en: Okay, so that means to examine or to take a look.
segments.cn: 好的，这意味着检查或看一看。

segments.en: Take a look at, that's right.
segments.cn: 看一看，没错。

segments.en: So to look something over or to look it over.
segments.cn: 所以查看某样东西或看一看。

segments.en: All right, so basically to examine, maybe in close detail, right?
segments.cn: 好的，基本上是仔细检查，也许是详细阅读，对吧？

segments.en: You actually take the time to read it.
segments.cn: 你确实花时间去阅读它。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And then later on, they started talking about her background.
segments.cn: 然后后来，他们开始谈论她的背景。

segments.en: As we know, she was from Brooklyn, she grew up in Brooklyn, and then she moved to London.
segments.cn: 正如我们所知，她来自布鲁克林，她在布鲁克林长大，然后搬到了伦敦。

segments.en: And so Rebecca described how she spent most of her life moving from country to country.
segments.cn: 所以丽贝卡描述了她大部分时间在不同国家之间移动。

segments.en: Okay, from country to country.
segments.cn: 好的，从一个国家到另一个国家。

segments.en: This means that she moved to many different countries.
segments.cn: 这意味着她搬到了许多不同的国家。

segments.en: Okay, so if I live in America all my life, I never moved from country to country.
segments.cn: 好的，所以如果我一辈子都住在美国，我就没有从一个国家搬到另一个国家。

segments.en: You could say this about many different things, from place to place, from town to town.
segments.cn: 你可以对许多不同的事情这样说，从一个地方到另一个地方，从一个城镇到另一个城镇。

segments.en: It means that you live in one, you go from one place to another.
segments.cn: 这意味着你住在一个地方，然后从一个地方去另一个地方。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So as you said, if you replace the noun country, you can say from town to town.
segments.cn: 所以正如你所说，如果你替换名词国家，你可以说从城镇到城镇。

segments.en: You can even say from house to house.
segments.cn: 你甚至可以说从房子到房子。

segments.en: I went from house to house asking for money.
segments.cn: 我从房子到房子乞讨。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So from hmm to hmm.
segments.cn: 所以从嗯到嗯。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So from something to something.
segments.cn: 所以从某样东西到某样东西。

segments.en: And for our final phrase, she was talking about how she's moved around so much that she's actually ready to settle down.
segments.cn: 在我们的最后一个短语中，她谈到她搬来搬去太多，以至于她实际上准备安定下来。

segments.en: Okay, to settle down.
segments.cn: 好的，安定下来。

segments.en: This is a really important phrase, and I think it's something a lot of people do when they're maybe in their 30s or 40s.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常重要的短语，我认为这是很多人在30或40岁时会做的事情。

segments.en: They don't want to move anymore.
segments.cn: 他们不想再搬了。

segments.en: So to settle down means to stay in one place.
segments.cn: 所以安定下来意味着待在一个地方。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So you stay in one place.
segments.cn: 所以你待在一个地方。

segments.en: And it can have a lot of different meanings as well.
segments.cn: 这也可以有很多不同的含义。

segments.en: For example, to get married, many people say that's settling down.
segments.cn: 例如，结婚，很多人说那是安定下来。

segments.en: It means you want to stay in one place and have a family.
segments.cn: 这意味着你想待在一个地方并组建家庭。

segments.en: Or to buy a house because it means that you will live there for a long time.
segments.cn: 或者买一栋房子，因为这意味着你会在那儿住很长时间。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: So to settle down.
segments.cn: 所以安定下来。

segments.en: So a lot of interesting phrases there, a lot of words.
segments.cn: 这里有很多有趣的短语，很多词汇。

segments.en: And this is, as we said, part two of our series.
segments.cn: 这是我们系列的第二部分。

segments.en: So I think it would be worthy for us to listen to this dialogue one last time.
segments.cn: 我认为我们应该最后再听一次这个对话。

segments.en: And we'll be back to talk a little bit more.
segments.cn: 然后我们会回来再聊一聊。

segments.en: Now, Miss Child's passed on your resume to me, and I've had a chance to look it over.
segments.cn: 现在，Child小姐把你的简历转给我，我有机会看过了。

segments.en: I must say, I'm quite impressed.
segments.cn: 我必须说，我很印象深刻。

segments.en: Thank you very much.
segments.cn: 非常感谢。

segments.en: I've tried to keep it short and clear.
segments.cn: 我尽量保持简短明了。

segments.en: If there are any questions, please feel free to ask me.
segments.cn: 如果有任何问题，请随时问我。

segments.en: Well, yes, I do have a number of questions.
segments.cn: 嗯，是的，我确实有一些问题。

segments.en: But perhaps first you could give me a brief overview.
segments.cn: 但也许你可以先给我一个简要概述。

segments.en: I'd like to get a little bit of an idea of your background.
segments.cn: 我想了解一下你的背景。

segments.en: Yes, of course.
segments.cn: 是的，当然。

segments.en: Well, as you can see from the resume, I'm 27 and grew up in Brooklyn, New York.
segments.cn: 像你从简历上看到的，我27岁，成长于纽约布鲁克林。

segments.en: Although our family moved to London when I was quite young, at around 16.
segments.cn: 尽管我们家在我很小的时候，大约16岁时搬到了伦敦。

segments.en: Ah, I see.
segments.cn: 啊，我明白了。

segments.en: So you were actually educated in Europe.
segments.cn: 所以你实际上是在欧洲受教育的。

segments.en: Yes, precisely.
segments.cn: 是的，确切地说。

segments.en: Although I was born in the US, I would definitely call London home.
segments.cn: 虽然我出生在美国，但我绝对称伦敦为家。

segments.en: But as you see, I've actually spent a lot of my life moving from country to country.
segments.cn: 但如你所见，我实际上花了很多时间在不同国家之间移动。

segments.en: My father was in the oil business before he retired.
segments.cn: 我父亲在退休前从事石油行业。

segments.en: So we also spent a number of years in Saudi Arabia, too.
segments.cn: 所以我们也在沙特阿拉伯待了好几年。

segments.en: Very interesting.
segments.cn: 非常有趣。

segments.en: So it seems you had quite an adventurous childhood.
segments.cn: 所以看来你有一个相当冒险的童年。

segments.en: Absolutely.
segments.cn: 绝对是。

segments.en: We were never still for too long.
segments.cn: 我们从来没有停留太久。

segments.en: But now I'm really looking to settle down.
segments.cn: 但现在我真的想安定下来。

segments.en: I see.
segments.cn: 我明白了。

segments.en: Okay, well, let's move on to discuss your education, shall we?
segments.cn: 好吧，我们来讨论一下你的教育背景，可以吗？

segments.en: Sure.
segments.cn: 当然。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So this is part two of a 10 part series of the interviews.
segments.cn: 这是10部分系列访谈的第二部分。

segments.en: Now, we just talked about the background.
segments.cn: 现在，我们刚刚谈到了背景。

segments.en: And I think there are different ways of talking about your background, right?
segments.cn: 我认为谈论你的背景有不同的方式，对吗？

segments.en: This is maybe your personal background.
segments.cn: 这可能是你的个人背景。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So you can talk about your personal history, your personal background, where you were born, where you were educated, where you grew up.
segments.cn: 所以你可以谈论你的个人历史、个人背景、你出生的地方、受教育的地方、成长的地方。

segments.en: But a lot of times, we also have to talk about other parts of our background, like our work background, or like next week, our educational background.
segments.cn: 但很多时候，我们也必须谈论我们背景的其他部分，比如我们的工作背景，或者下周的教育背景。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So part three, we're going to take a look at your educational background.
segments.cn: 所以在第三部分，我们将看看你的教育背景。

segments.en: And it's going to be very important, because I think in many interviews, people have a hard time describing what they studied, or maybe describing exactly what they did during university or college or master's degree or something.
segments.cn: 这将非常重要，因为我认为在许多面试中，人们很难描述他们所学的内容，或者准确描述他们在大学、学院或硕士学位期间所做的事情。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 确切地说。

segments.en: And we're not talking about elementary school or high school.
segments.cn: 我们不是在谈论小学或高中。

segments.en: We're specifically talking about university background here.
segments.cn: 我们这里特别谈论大学背景。

segments.en: So like you're saying, Marco, what was your major?
segments.cn: 所以像你说的，Marco，你的专业是什么？

segments.en: What was your minor?
segments.cn: 你的辅修是什么？

segments.en: What was your area of study?
segments.cn: 你的研究领域是什么？

segments.en: These are great, great, great phrases that are very important for an interview.
segments.cn: 这些都是非常重要的面试短语。

segments.en: And so we hope that if you have any questions, you'll let us know.
segments.cn: 所以我们希望如果你有任何问题，请告诉我们。

segments.en: Our website is EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 我们的网站是EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: And stay tuned for next week's episode.
segments.cn: 请继续关注下周的节目。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Okay, so we'll see everyone on the website.
segments.cn: 好的，我们在网站上见。

segments.en: And until next time.
segments.cn: 下次再见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
